data.chText: 自行决定的自由；自行决定权
data.enText: the freedom or power to decide what should be done in a particular situation

data.chText: 我把这件事留给你自己斟酌决定。
data.enText: I'll leave it up to you to use your discretion .

data.chText: 晚期病人的病情让本人知道多少由医生自行决定。
data.enText: How much to tell terminally ill patients is left to the discretion of the doctor.

data.chText: 谨慎；慎重；审慎
data.enText: care in what you say or do, in order to keep sth secret or to avoid causing embarrassment to or difficulty for sb; the quality of being discreet

data.chText: 这是机密，不过我知道你靠得住。
data.enText: This is confidential, but I know that I can rely on your discretion.
at sb's discretion

data.chText: 由某人斟酌决定；按照某人的意见
data.enText: according to what sb decides or wishes to do

data.chText: 由法庭决定准予保释。
data.enText: Bail is granted at the discretion of the court.

data.chText: 不收服务费，给不给小费由你自行决定。
data.enText: There is no service charge and tipping is at your discretion.
discretion is the better part of valour

data.chText: 谨慎即大勇；慎重为勇敢之本
data.enText: you should avoid danger and not take unnecessary risks

data.chText: 以上各词均指小心、谨慎。
data.enText: These are all words for attention or thought that you give to sth in order to avoid mistakes or accidents.
care

data.chText: 指小心、谨慎以做好某事，同时避免出现错误或损失：
data.enText: attention or thought that you give to sth that you are doing so that you will do it well and avoid mistakes or damage

data.chText: 她措辞谨慎。
data.enText: She chose her words with care.
caution

data.chText: 指小心、谨慎，以免发生危险或错误：
data.enText: care that you take in order to avoid danger or mistakes; not taking any risks

data.chText: 处理爆炸品一定要慎之又慎。
data.enText: The utmost caution must be exercised when handling explosives.
prudence

data.chText: 指判断和决策时谨慎、慎重，处事时避免不必要的风险：
data.enText: ( rather formal ) being sensible and careful when you make judgements and decisions; avoiding unnecessary risks

data.chText: 为慎重起见，请记下你所有的财务往来。
data.enText: As a matter of prudence, keep a record of all your financial transactions.

data.chText: prudence尤用于金融、财务方面。
data.enText: Prudence is used particularly in financial contexts.
discretion

data.chText: 指说话、办事审慎，以保守秘密或避免使人难堪、为难：
data.enText: ( rather formal ) care in what you say or do, in order to keep sth secret or to avoid causing embarrassment or difficulty for sb; the quality of being discreet

data.chText: 这是机密，不过我知道你靠得住。
data.enText: This is confidential, but I know that I can rely on your discretion.
wariness

data.chText: 指在认为可能发生危险或问题的情况下待人接物特别留神：
data.enText: [sing.] ( formal ) care when dealing with sb/sth because you think there may be a danger or problem

data.chText: 她对他的警惕变成了极度的不信任。
data.enText: Her wariness of him turned to deepest mistrust.

data.chText: 用caution还是wariness？
在涉及人身或金融风险的事情或情况用caution。wariness常为对认为可能是危险或不可信任的人的反应。
data.enText: You use caution when dealing with things or situations that involve physical or financial risk. Wariness is more often a reaction to people that you think might be dangerous or not to be trusted.
caution or wariness?
to do sth with care/caution/prudence/discretion/wariness
great/extreme care/caution/prudence/discretion/wariness
to need/require/call for/urge/advise/exercise/use care/caution/prudence/discretion
to proceed with care/caution

simple_means.memory_skill: dis 加强 + cret 搞清；区别 + ion 表状态 → 一再搞清楚 → 谨慎

ex.enText: Freedom of speech is guaranteed by the constitution.

ex.chText: 你是怎么看待公民的权利和自由的？
ex.enText: What is your opinion about the rights and freedoms of citizens?
Kids have too much freedom nowadays.

ex.chText: 他蹲了10年监狱后终于获得了自由。
ex.enText: He finally won his freedom after ten years in jail.

synonyms.bx: 指权利方面的自由，多用于个人言论、信仰、行动等方面；也指不受关押、奴役的自由状态。

ex.chText: 如何处理这些投诉由你斟酌决定。
ex.enText: How to deal with these complaints is left to your discretion.

ex.chText: 候选人是由委员会选出的。
ex.enText: The candidates were chosen at the discretion of the committee.

synonyms.bx: 指面对某一情况时决定该如何处理的自由或权利。

ex.chText: 他认为每个人都应该为了自由和平等而奋斗。
ex.enText: He believes that everyone should fight for liberty and equality.

ex.chText: 你对言论自由等合法权利有什么看法？
ex.enText: What is your opinion about liberties such as freedom of speech?

ex.chText: 她得忍受10个月失去自由之苦。
ex.enText: She has to endure ten months' loss of liberty.

synonyms.bx: 指生活方式不受政府或权威限制的自由，适用范围比较广泛；也指某方面的合法权利或不受关押、奴役的自由状态。

data.enText: at sb's discretion

data.chText: 由某人斟酌决定；按照某人的意见
data.enText: according to what sb decides or wishes to do

data.chText: 由法庭决定准予保释。
data.enText: Bail is granted at the discretion of the court.

data.chText: 不收服务费，给不给小费由你自行决定。
data.enText: There is no service charge and tipping is at your discretion.
discretion is the better part of valour

data.chText: 谨慎即大勇；慎重为勇敢之本
data.enText: you should avoid danger and not take unnecessary risks

tr: the trait of judging wisely and objectively
the power of making free choices unconstrained by external agencies
knowing how to avoid embarrassment or distress
example: the servants showed great tact and discretion

tr: freedom to act or judge on one's own

value.def: Discretion is the quality of behaving in a quiet and controlled way without drawing attention to yourself or giving away personal or private information.

example.ex: Larsson sometimes joined in the fun, but with more discretion...
example.tran: 拉森有时会和大家一起玩乐，但是显得更加矜持。

example.ex: He appreciated his discretion and his fidelity.
example.tran: 他欣赏他的谨慎和忠诚。

value.def: If someone in a position of authority uses their discretion or has the discretion to do something in a particular situation, they have the freedom and authority to decide what to do.

example.ex: This committee may want to exercise its discretion to look into those charges...
example.tran: 这个委员会可能想行使其自行决定权来调查那些指控。

example.ex: School governors have the discretion to allow parents to withdraw pupils in exceptional circumstances.
example.tran: 学校管理者有权允许家长们在特殊情况下让学生退学。

value.tran: 自行决定的自由;酌情决定权

value.def: If something happens at someone's discretion, it can happen only if they decide to do it or give their permission.

example.ex: We may vary the limit at our discretion and will notify you of any change...
example.tran: 我们可能会斟酌改变限额，有任何变动将通知您。

example.ex: Where there are no service charges added to the bill, tip at your discretion...
example.tran: 凡账单上没收服务费的，是否付小费由你自己决定。

example.ex: Visits are at the discretion of the owners.
example.tran: 是否接受参观访问由业主决定。

gramarinfo.label: usu PHR after v, v-link PHR

value.def: If you say discretion is the better part of valour, you mean that avoiding a dangerous or unpleasant situation is sometimes the most sensible thing to do.
value.tran: 谨慎即大勇;勇敢贵在审慎

rootsaffixes.indicate: = to be sure, to separate 搞清；区别
rootsaffixes.title: cern, cert, cret, crimin

partsOfSpeech.dec: as 加强 + certain 肯定的 → 一再区别 → 确定
cert 搞清；区别 + ain 表名词 → 搞清的 → 肯定的
cert 搞清；区别 + ific 产生…的 + ate 表总称 → 能够作证明的东西 → 证明书
cert 搞清；区别 + ify 使… → 使…清楚 → 证明
cert 搞清；区别 + itude 表情况 → 搞清楚 → 确信
con 加强 + cern 搞清；区别 → 需要搞清楚 → 关心
dis 加强 + cern 搞清；区别 → 识别
dis 加强 + cret 搞清；区别 + e → 加以区别 → 不同的
dis 加强 + cret 搞清；区别 + ion 表状态 → 一再搞清楚 → 谨慎
dis 加强 + crimin 搞清；区别 + ate 做，造成，使… → 区分〔对待〕→ 区别；歧视
dis 加强 + crimin 搞清；区别 + at〔e〕具有…的，有…性质的 + ing 正…的，令人…的 → 有辨别能力的
in 不 + discriminate 歧视 → 不加区别的；一视同仁的
partsOfSpeech.d: 不加区别的；一视同仁的
